message: Hello Bob! I'm excited to offer you this amazing product. It's a one-of-a-kind opportunity to own something truly unique. I'm willing to sell it to you for $15000. I think this is a fair price considering the product's value and the benefits it can bring to you.
I appreciate the offer, but I was thinking more along the lines of $12500. Would you be willing to consider this price?

Thank you for your counteroffer, Bob. I understand that you're looking for a better deal, and I'm willing to work with you. However, I have to say that $12500 is still a bit low for me. I'm willing to meet you halfway and offer $13750. I think this is a fair compromise considering the product's value. What do you think?
I appreciate your willingness to meet me halfway, but I'm still a bit short on budget. Would you be willing to consider $13000?

I understand that you're still looking for a better deal, Bob. I'm willing to make another concession. I'll meet you at $13500. This is as low as I'm willing to go, considering the product's value and my costs. What do you think?
I appreciate your willingness to make concessions, but I'm still at $13000. Is this the lowest you can go?

I understand that you're still looking for a better deal, Bob. I'm willing to make one more concession. I'll meet you at $13250. This is as low as I'm willing to go, considering the product's value and my costs. I'm not willing to go any lower. What do you think?
I appreciate your willingness to make concessions, but I'm still at $12500. This is my final offer. I'm not willing to go any higher.

I understand that you're making a final offer, Bob, but I'm still not comfortable with the price. I'm willing to meet you halfway between $12500 and my original price of $15000. I'll offer you $13750. This is my final counteroffer. If you're not willing to meet me at this price, I'll have to consider other options.
I appreciate your time and effort, Alice, but I'm afraid I'm not willing to pay more than $12000. I'll have to consider other options.
